bugs.title: optipng: Buffer overflow in global memory [epel-6]

bugzilla.short_desc: optipng: Buffer overflow in global memory [epel-6]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-7802 optipng: Buffer overflow in global memory

long_desc.thetext:
A buffer overflow vulnerability using specially crafted gif file in optipng 0.7.5 was found.

CVE request (includes crash report and reproducer):

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2015/q3/632

Created optipng tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1265961]
Affects: epel-5 [bug 1265962]
Affects: epel-6 [bug 1265963]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of Fedora EPEL.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

epel-6 tracking bug for optipng: see blocks bug list for full details of the security issue(s).

This bug is never intended to be made public, please put any public notes
in the blocked bugs.

bugs.title: CVE-2016-2191 CVE-2016-3981 CVE-2016-3982 optipng: various flaws fixed in 0.7.6 [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2016-2191 CVE-2016-3981 CVE-2016-3982 optipng: various flaws fixed in 0.7.6 [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2016-2191 optipng: Invalid write while processing delta escapes without any boundary checking

long_desc.thetext:
Created optipng tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1323936]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1323937]

Public via:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2016/q2/10
optipng-0.7.6-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
optipng-0.7.6-1.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

Statement:

Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Moderate security impact. This issue is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2016-3981 optipng: heap buffer overflow in the bmp_read_rows function

long_desc.thetext:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the bmp_read_rows function in pngxrbmp.c
in OptiPNG before 0.7.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of
service (out-of-bounds read or write access and crash) or possibly
execute arbitrary code via a crafted image file.

External references, including reproducer and patch:

https://sourceforge.net/p/optipng/bugs/56/

Created optipng tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1327221]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1327222]

Patch is merged with CVE-2016-2191, presented as a set of 2 patches :
  -> https://sourceforge.net/p/optipng/bugs/56/#5168
  -> https://sourceforge.net/p/optipng/bugs/56/#d6e6

Statement:

Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Moderate security impact. This issue is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2016-3982 optipng: heap buffer overflow in the bmp_rle4_fread function

long_desc.thetext:
Off-by-one error in the bmp_rle4_fread function in pngxrbmp.c in
OptiPNG before 0.7.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of
service (out-of-bounds read or write access and crash) or possibly
execute arbitrary code via a crafted image file, which triggers a
heap-based buffer overflow.

External references that includes reproducer and patch:

https://sourceforge.net/p/optipng/bugs/57/

Created optipng tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1327221]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1327222]

Statement:

Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Moderate security impact. This issue is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.
